original: Source: CYTODYN INC., 10-Q, 1/9/2020 1.8 “API” means an active pharmaceutical ingredient, whether produced from a living organism or through synthetic process (i.e., any substance intended to be used in the manufacture of a drug product and that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity in the cure, treatment or prevention of disease).

original: 1.22 “Combination Product ” means a product that is Commercialized by Vyera and/or its Affiliates under this Agreement and that comprises, consists of, or incorporates two or more APIs (whether administered together or separately), which includes leronlimab as one of the APIs together with one or more additional APIs that: (a) are not leronlimab; and (b) are not proprietary to CytoDyn, regardless of the formulation or mode of administration of such Combination Product. For the sake of clarity, a Combination Product is a Licensed Product.
ollama_generated: 1.22 "Combination Product" refers to any product that is Commercialized by Vyera and/or its Affiliates under this Agreement, which consists of two or more Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs), one of which is leronlimab, combined with one or more additional APIs that are neither leronlimab nor proprietary to CytoDyn. The formulation or mode of administration of such Combination Product does not affect this definition. Importantly, a Combination Product is considered a Licensed Product under the terms of this agreement, but Vyera and its Affiliates maintain sole responsibility for the development, manufacturing, and commercialization of any combination that may not meet CytoDyn's proprietary criteria.

original: 1.26 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts ” means: (a) with respect to the efforts to be expended, or considerations to be undertaken, by a Party or its Affiliate with respect to any objective, activity or decision to be undertaken hereunder, reasonable, good faith efforts to accomplish such objective, activity or decision as such Party would normally use to accomplish a similar objective, activity or decision under similar circumstances; and (b) with respect to Development and Commercialization  of any Licensed Product for any indication by a Party, efforts and resources consistent with those efforts and resources commonly used by a similarly situated biotechnology company with respect to a product owned by it or to which it has similar rights, which product is at a similar stage in its development or product life and is of similar market potential  taking into account (i) the patent and other proprietary position of the Licensed Product and (ii) the anticipated profitability of the Licensed Product.
ollama_generated: 1.26 "Commercially Prudent Efforts" shall denote: (a) as pertaining to the initiatives and deliberations conducted by a Party or its Affiliate regarding any objective, operation, or decision to be executed under this Agreement, a prudent and diligent effort, in good faith, to achieve such objective, operation, or decision, equivalent to what such Party would employ for a comparable purpose under similar circumstances; and (b) with respect to the Development and Commercialization of any Licensed Product for any specified indication by a Party, efforts and resources proportional to those commonly employed by a comparably situated biotechnology company with regard to a product owned or controlled by it, which product is at a comparable stage in its development or commercial lifecycle, and holds similar market potential. This assessment shall consider (i) the patent and proprietary standing of the Licensed Product and (ii) the anticipated profits from the Licensed Product, but recognize that these efforts may not guarantee maximum profitability or rapid success.

original: 1.53 “Force Majeure ” means any event beyond the reasonable control of the affected Party that materially affects the Party’s performance of its obligations, except payment obligations, under this Agreement, including embargoes; war or acts of war, including terrorism; insurrections, riots, or civil unrest; strikes, lockouts or other labor disturbances; epidemics, fire, floods, earthquakes, tsunamis, hurricanes or other acts of nature; or acts, omissions or delays in acting by any Governmental Authority (including the refusal of the competent Governmental Authorities to issue required Regulatory Approvals due to reasons other than the affected Party’s negligence or willful misconduct or any other cause within the reasonable control of the affected Party) and failure of plant or machinery (provided that such event or failure could not have been prevented by the exercise of skill, diligence, and prudence that would be reasonably and ordinarily expected from a skilled and experienced person engaged in the same type of undertaking under the same or similar circumstances).
ollama_generated: 1.53 "Exceptional Circumstances" denotes any occurrence outside the reasonable management of the implicated Party that significantly impedes their ability to fulfill their commitments under this Agreement, excluding debt-related obligations, and comprises the following: government-imposed sanctions; armed conflicts or acts of warfare, such as terrorism; civil commotions, unrest, or insurrections; labor disputes like strikes, lockouts, or other work disruptions; outbreaks of diseases; natural calamities including fires, floods, earthquakes, tsunamis, hurricanes, and other weather-related events; actions or inactions of any Governmental Authority (excluding instances where the affected Party's negligence or wilful misconduct is involved), and failures in infrastructure or equipment (provided such event or failure could not have been averted through the application of ordinary skill, diligence, and caution expected from someone competent in this field under similar conditions).

original: 1.63 “Inventions ” means any and all inventions, discoveries and developments, whether or not patentable, which are conceived and reduced to practice relating to the Licensed Product in the Field after the Effective Date and arising in the course of activities under this Agreement: (a) solely by one or more employees or consultants of CytoDyn; (b) solely by one or more employees or consultants of Vyera; or (c) jointly by one or more employees or consultants of CytoDyn and one or more employees or consultants of Vyera. For clarification, Inventions as defined here do not encompass any patents owned by CytoDyn prior to the Effective Date. However, it is to be noted that this Agreement does not extend to any inventions, discoveries, or advancements that were conceived and reduced to practice before the Effective Date, regardless of their originator or relation to the Licensed Product within the Field.

original: (a) Nothing in this Agreement is intended to, nor shall it, prevent CytoDyn from (i) Developing, Manufacturing and or Commercializing leronlimab inside or outside of the Territory for use outside of the Field or (ii) Developing or Manufacturing leronlimab inside or outside of the Territory for Commercialization within the Field outside of the Territory, in each case, to the extent such actions would not result in a breach of CytoDyn’s obligations to use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to perform the activities set forth in the Development Plan.
ollama_generated:
(a) This Agreement does not restrict CytoDyn from undertaking any of the following actions, which may be exercised within or beyond the Territory:

   (i) Developing, Manufacturing, and Commercializing leronlimab for uses outside the Field, or
   (ii) Developing or Manufacturing leronlimab, with the intention to commercialize within the Field, outside of the Territory. However, these actions shall not be exercised in a manner that would conflict with CytoDyn's commitment to apply Commercially Reasonable Efforts towards executing the activities outlined in the Development Plan, unless such actions are expressly authorized by the parties or required by law.

original: 2.6 Competitive Products . Except as expressly required under this Agreement, Vyera hereby covenants not to Develop, Manufacture, Commercialize or otherwise exploit a Competitive Product in the Territory during the Royalty Term, including by means of an Affiliate. In the event that Vyera experiences a Change of Control with a Third Party that is actively engaged in the Development, Manufacture or Commercialization of a Competitive Product, then, Vyera shall either: (a) within ninety (90) days after the closing of such Change of Control, enter into a binding written agreement to sell, transfer, assign or divest all of Vyera’s and/or its Affiliate’s rights in and to such Competitive Product to a non-Affiliate  Third Party and consummate such sale, transfer, assignment or divestiture of said rights not later than ninety (90) days following the date of the binding Agreement; or (b) within six (6) months after the closing of such Change of Control, terminate any and all Development, Manufacturing, Commercialization and/or other exploitation of such Competitive Product; or (c) terminate this Agreement in accordance with Section  11.2(c) . For the avoidance of doubt, Vyera shall not be deemed to be in breach of this Section  2.6 (i) during the one hundred eighty (180) day period following a Change of Control described in this Section  2.6 (the “ Disposition Period ”) so long as it has complied with its obligations under the immediately preceding clause (a), (b) or (c) prior to the end of the Disposition Period and (ii) during the pendency of the one hundred eighty (180)day notice period required pursuant to Section  11.2(c)  elects to terminate this Agreement pursuant to the immediately preceding clause (c) prior to the end of the Disposition Period.
modified: 2.6 Competitive Products . Vyera reserves the right, unless otherwise required by this Agreement, to Develop, Manufacture, Commercialize or exploit a Competitive Product within the Territory during the Royalty Term, provided that such actions are undertaken through an Affiliate. In the event of a Change of Control with a Third Party actively involved in the Development, Manufacture, or Commercialization of a Competitive Product, Vyera may choose to: (a) negotiate and execute a binding written agreement within ninety (90) days after the closing of such Change of Control to acquire, from a non-Affiliate Third Party, all rights to said Competitive Product; or (b) continue Development, Manufacturing, Commercialization, and/or exploitation of the Competitive Product for up to six (6) months following the closing of such Change of Control, at which point Vyera may elect to terminate this Agreement if deemed necessary, in accordance with Section 11.2(c). For clarity, Vyera will not be considered in breach of this Section 2.6 during the 180-day period following a Change of Control described herein (the “ Transition Period ”), provided that it has either: (i) entered into an acquisition agreement within the specified timeframe; or (ii) made the decision to terminate this Agreement in accordance with Section 11.2(c) during the pendency of the required 180-day notice period.

original: The JC will render decisions by unanimous vote. The members of the JC shall act in good faith to cooperate with one another and to reach agreement with respect to issues to be decided by the JC.
ollama_generated: Decisions rendered by the Joint Committee (JC) may be reached through a majority vote, provided that each member makes a sincere effort to collaborate and seek common ground with their fellow committee members. While it is expected that the members of the JC will strive for consensus, individual dissenting opinions shall not automatically impede the execution of the committee's decisions, so long as they are supported by a majority of the committee members.

original: ARTICLE 5 COMMERCIALIZATION 5.1 General . Vyera shall have the exclusive right to implement, and subject to Section  5.5, final decision-making authority with respect to, Commercialization of all Licensed Products in the Field and the Territory. Vyera shall be solely and exclusively responsible for all costs and expenses associated with Commercialization of Licensed Products in the Field and the Territory. Vyera shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts in connection with such Commercialization of Licensed Products in the Territory for each indication in the Field for which such Licensed Products have received Regulatory Approval, and shall conduct Commercialization activities in material compliance with Applicable Laws and shall ensure that its Third Party contractors conduct Commercialization activities in material compliance with Applicable Laws. Without limiting the foregoing, Vyera shall have the exclusive right and responsibility throughout the Territory for the following: (a) receiving and accepting orders for the Licensed Product from customers; (b) distributing the Licensed Product to customers; (c) controlling invoicing and collection of accounts receivable for Licensed Product sales; (d) recording Licensed Product sales in its books of account for sales (in accordance with Vyera’s accounting standards consistently applied (currently GAAP)); (e) subject to Section  5.5, determining pricing for the Licensed Product and all aspects of the promotion (including promotional materials) to be used in Commercializing Licensed Products; (f) negotiating with Third Parties, including without limitation, payors, pharmacy benefit managers and distributors, with respect to sales and distribution of Licensed Product; and (g) paying all rebates, chargebacks and other amounts due to customers in respect of Licensed Products (it being understood that all such amounts shall be deducted in calculating Net Sales). Notwithstanding the foregoing, CytoDyn acknowledges and agrees that in the event Vyera delivers to CytoDyn a notice of termination pursuant to Sections 11.2(b)  or (c), the use of Commercially Reasonable Efforts shall take into account Vyera’s intent to cease its Commercialization activities as of the end of the applicable notice period and shall not require Vyera to take any action that is inconsistent with such intent.
modified:
ARTICLE 5 COMMERCIALIZATION

5.1 General. CytoDyn grants Vyera non-exclusive rights, subject to Section 5.5, to implement and share decision-making authority regarding Commercialization of all Licensed Products in the Field and the Territory. While Vyera will engage in Commercialization efforts for Licensed Products, it is not solely responsible for any costs or expenses related to Commercialization; risks and costs are shared between the parties. Vyera shall conduct Commercialization activities in accordance with Applicable Laws and ensure that its Third Party contractors do the same.

Without limiting the foregoing, CytoDyn acknowledges and agrees that Vyera has the right to: (a) receive orders for Licensed Products from customers; (b) distribute the Licensed Product to customers; (c) invoice and collect accounts receivable for Licensed Product sales; (d) record Licensed Product sales in its books of account for sales (in accordance with Vyera’s accounting standards consistently applied); (e) negotiate pricing for the Licensed Product, promotional materials, and aspects of promotion with Third Parties, including payors, pharmacy benefit managers, and distributors; (f) pay all rebates, chargebacks, and other amounts due to customers in respect of Licensed Products.

In case Vyera delivers a notice of termination pursuant to Sections 11.2(b) or (c), the use of Commercially Reasonable Efforts shall not require Vyera to take any action that is inconsistent with its intent to cease Commercialization activities, and the effort level will be adjusted accordingly during the applicable notice period.

original: 5.4 Licensed Product Trademarks.
ollama_generated:
5.4 Trademark Usage of Licensed Products:

The Licensor hereby grants to the Licensee a non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable right to use the trademarks associated with the Licensed Products, solely for the purpose of identifying the products as licensed by the Licensor. The Licensee shall not assert any proprietary rights in the trademarks or attempt to register them independently, but shall maintain the trademarks in accordance with the standards and guidelines provided by the Licensor from time to time. Any misuse of the trademarks by the Licensee may result in termination of this agreement.

original: 6.2 Supply Agreement . The Parties shall enter into a Supply Agreement(s) for the commercial supply of Licensed Product on the Effective Date. The Supply Agreement(s) shall be in the form attached as Attachment  D, with such changes (if any) mutually agreed by the Parties in writing.
ollama_generated: 6.2 Supply Agreement Modification: Each Party retains the right to propose amendments to the form of the Supply Agreement(s) for the commercial supply of Licensed Product, as set out in Attachment D, prior to its execution. Any agreed modifications shall be binding upon both Parties, subject to their written consent. The initial Supply Agreement(s), if not mutually amended, will come into effect on the Effective Date.

original: Source: CYTODYN INC., 10-Q, 1/9/2020 7.2 Inspections. To the extent permitted under Applicable Law and, if applicable, its relevant Third Party agreements,  (a) CytoDyn shall provide Vyera with reasonable advance notice of any scheduled regulatory inspection of CytoDyn or Third Party Manufacturing facilities used for supply of the Licensed Product as contemplated by Article 6 , and (b) Vyera shall be allowed to participate in any pre-approval  readiness activities and audits for CytoDyn or its Third Party Manufacturing facilities. CytoDyn or its applicable Third Party manufacturer of Licensed Product shall control all interactions with Regulatory Authorities with respect to such inspection. To the extent permitted under Applicable Law and, if applicable, CytoDyn’s relevant Third Party agreements, Vyera shall have the right to be present during such inspection. CytoDyn shall use its Commercially Reasonable Efforts to ensure that any applicable Third Party manufacturer of Licensed Product is obligated to provide such access to Vyera (to the extent that CytoDyn has such rights of access). So long as CytoDyn is supplying Vyera supplies of Licensed Products pursuant to the Supply Agreement, it shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to obtain and maintain such rights of access for Vyera.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: CYTODYN INC., 10-Q, 1/9/2020
7.2 Inspections. Under Applicable Law and any relevant Third Party agreements (if applicable), Vyera shall have the right to receive notice of any scheduled regulatory inspection of CytoDyn or Third Party Manufacturing facilities providing the Licensed Product as per Article 6. Upon receipt of such notice, CytoDyn may allow Vyera to participate in pre-approval readiness activities and audits for its own facilities or those of its Third Party Manufacturers, at its discretion. The regulatory authorities' interactions during these inspections shall be controlled by either CytoDyn or the applicable Third Party manufacturer of Licensed Product. Where permitted under Applicable Law and relevant Third Party agreements, Vyera shall have the right to request access to such inspections. CytoDyn shall use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to facilitate this access for Vyera (provided that it has the requisite rights), if applicable. It is understood that CytoDyn's obligation to supply Licensed Products to Vyera under the Supply Agreement will not be affected by its efforts to grant or deny access during inspections.

original: 8.11 Audit . Vyera shall maintain, and shall cause its Affiliates to maintain, complete and accurate records in sufficient detail to permit CytoDyn to confirm the accuracy of the calculation of royalties and milestones due under this Agreement. Upon reasonable prior notice, but not more than once per Calendar Year, such records of Vyera and its Affiliates shall be available during Vyera’s and its Affiliates regular business hours for a period of three (3) years from the end of the Calendar Year to which they pertain for examination at the expense of CytoDyn by an independent certified public accountant selected by CytoDyn and reasonably acceptable to Vyera, for the sole purpose of verifying the accuracy of the financial reports and correctness of the payments furnished by Vyera pursuant to this Agreement. Any such auditor shall not disclose Vyera’s Confidential Information, except to the extent such disclosure is necessary to verify the accuracy of the financial reports furnished by Vyera or the amount of payments due by Vyera under this Agreement. Any amounts shown to be owed but unpaid shall be paid within thirty (30) days from the accountant’s report, plus interest, as set forth in Section  8.12 from the original due date. Any amounts shown to have been overpaid shall be refunded within thirty (30) days from the accountant’s report. CytoDyn shall bear the full cost of such audit unless such audit discloses an underpayment by Vyera of more than five percent (5%) of the amount due, in which case Vyera shall bear the full cost of such audit. The audit rights set forth in this Section  8.11 shall survive the Term for a period of three (3) years.
ollama_generated:
8.11 Audit: CytoDyn shall have the right, upon reasonable prior notice and not more than once per Calendar Year, to conduct an audit at its own expense by an independent certified public accountant selected by it and acceptable to Vyera, for the purpose of verifying the accuracy of the financial reports and correctness of the payments made by CytoDyn pursuant to this Agreement. The records of Vyera and its Affiliates shall be made available during Vyera’s and its Affiliates' regular business hours for a period of three (3) years from the end of the Calendar Year to which they pertain, for the purpose of such audit. Any information disclosed by the auditor will be limited to what is necessary to verify the accuracy of the financial reports or the amount of payments made by CytoDyn under this Agreement, and shall not include any Confidential Information.

Any amounts shown to have been underpaid by CytoDyn shall be paid by Vyera within thirty (30) days from the accountant's report, plus interest, as set forth in Section 8.12, from the original due date. If it is found that there has been an overpayment by CytoDyn, Vyera shall refund the overpaid amount within thirty (30) days from the accountant's report. If the audit conducted by CytoDyn does not disclose an underpayment by Vyera of more than five percent (5%) of the amount due, then Vyera shall bear the full cost of such audit. The audit rights granted to CytoDyn in this Section 8.11 shall survive the Term for a period of three (3) years.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of conducting the audit from Vyera to CytoDyn and slightly weakens the obligation of Vyera by limiting the scope of information that can be disclosed during the audit, while still ensuring compliance with the original intention of allowing verification of payments made under the Agreement.

original: 8.12 Late Payment . All payments due to a Party under this Agreement shall be made in U.S. Dollars by wire transfer of immediately available funds into an account designated by the receiving Party. If a Party does not receive payment of any sum due to it on or before the due date, simple interest shall thereafter accrue on the sum due to such Party until the date of payment at the per annum rate of two percent (2%) over the then prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York City or the maximum rate allowable by Applicable Law, whichever is lower.
ollama_generated:
8.12 Delayed Payment. All payments owed to a Party under this Agreement shall be made in U.S. Dollars via wire transfer of funds into an account specified by the recipient Party. In the event that payment is received after the due date, no interest shall accrue on the outstanding sum until 30 days after the original due date. After this grace period, simple interest shall thereafter accumulate on the overdue amount at a per annum rate of two percent (2%) above the then prime rate quoted by Citibank in New York City or the maximum rate allowable by Applicable Law, whichever is higher.

The changes made to this clause weaken the obligation for timely payment and give a grace period before interest accrues, while maintaining a professional tone.

original: (g) If and whenever any Confidential Information is disclosed in accordance with this Section  10.3, such disclosure shall not cause any such information to cease to be Confidential Information except to the extent that such disclosure results in a public disclosure of such information (other than by breach of this Agreement). original: (b) All rights and licenses granted under or pursuant to this Agreement are, and shall otherwise be deemed to be, for purposes of Section 365(n) of Title 11 of the U.S. Code and other similar laws in any jurisdiction outside the U.S. (collectively, the “ Bankruptcy Laws ”), licenses of rights to “intellectual property” as defined under the Bankruptcy Laws. If a case is commenced during the Term by or against a Party under Bankruptcy Laws then, unless and until this Agreement is rejected as provided pursuant to such Bankruptcy Laws, such Party (in any capacity, including debtor-in-possession)  and its successors and assigns (including a Title 11 trustee) shall perform all of the obligations in this Agreement intended to be performed by such Party. If a case is commenced during the Term by or against a Party under the Bankruptcy Laws, this Agreement is rejected as provided for under the Bankruptcy Laws, and the non-bankrupt  Party elects to retain its rights hereunder as provided for under the Bankruptcy Laws, then the Party subject to such case under the Bankruptcy Laws (in any capacity, including debtor-in-possession)  and its successors and assigns (including a Title 11 trustee), shall continue to provide whatever rights held by and granted to the non-bankrupt  Party with respect to and as licensee of the Patents and Know How licensed hereunder as such rights existed hereunder immediately before the commencement of the case under the Bankruptcy Laws. All rights, powers and remedies of the non-bankrupt  Party as provided herein are in addition to and not in substitution for any and all other rights, powers and remedies now or hereafter existing at law or in equity (including the Bankruptcy Laws) in the event of the commencement of a case by or against a Party under the Bankruptcy Laws.
ollama_generated: (b) The rights and licenses granted under or pursuant to this Agreement, as interpreted for the purposes of Section 365(n) of Title 11 of the U.S. Code and other similar laws in any jurisdiction outside the U.S. (collectively, "Bankruptcy Laws"), are considered as licenses to "intellectual property" as defined under Bankruptcy Laws. If a bankruptcy case is initiated during the Term by or against either Party, the party not initiating the bankruptcy proceeding (hereafter referred to as the "Non-Debtor") shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon notice, and if it chooses not to do so, the Debtor (in any capacity, including debtor-in-possession) and its successors and assigns (including a Title 11 trustee), shall be relieved of their obligations under this Agreement, except for the obligation to continue providing the Non-Debtor with the rights held by and granted to it with respect to and as licensee of the Patents and Know How licensed hereunder. The Debtor's relief from obligations does not affect any rights, powers, or remedies that the Non-Debtor may have under this Agreement or at law or in equity (including the Bankruptcy Laws) in the event of a bankruptcy proceeding initiated by or against the Debtor. In case of termination of this Agreement by the Non-Debtor, all rights, powers, and remedies of the Non-Debtor as provided herein shall remain unaffected and not be considered as substitution for any other rights, powers, or remedies now or hereafter existing under the Bankruptcy Laws.

original: ARTICLE 12 DISPUTE RESOLUTION 12.1 Exclusive Dispute Resolution Mechanism . The Parties agree that the procedures set forth in this Article 12  shall be the exclusive mechanism for resolving any dispute, controversy, or claim between the Parties that may arise from time to time pursuant to this Agreement relating to either Party’s rights or obligations hereunder (each, a “ Dispute ”, and collectively, the “ Disputes ”) that is not resolved through good faith negotiation between the Parties.
modified:
ARTICLE 12 DISPUTE RESOLUTION

12.1 Flexible Dispute Resolution Mechanism. The Parties acknowledge that, while they shall endeavor to resolve any dispute, controversy, or claim (each, a "Dispute", and collectively, the "Disputes") arising from time to time under this Agreement concerning either Party's rights or obligations hereunder through good faith negotiation between the Parties, the procedures specified in this Article 12 shall not be considered the sole mechanism for resolving Disputes. The Parties further agree that they may seek alternative dispute resolution methods, provided such methods are mutually agreed upon by both Parties. In the event that no mutually acceptable method of resolution is found within a reasonable period, the procedures set forth in this Article 12 shall become binding and exclusive for the resolution of the Dispute.

original: 12.3 Arbitration .
ollama_generated:
12.3 Dispute Resolution Process:

In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement (a "Dispute"), either Party shall have the option to initiate a resolution process by providing written notice to the other Party, setting forth the details of the Dispute. If the Parties are unable to resolve the Dispute through good faith negotiations within thirty (30) days of receipt of such notice, the Dispute shall be submitted to a mutually agreed-upon third-party mediator for resolution. If the Parties fail to agree on a mediator within a reasonable time, either Party may submit the Dispute to binding arbitration administered by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) in accordance with its Arbitration Rules. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on both Parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. This clause is intended to be a mutual waiver of any rights either Party may have to litigate any Dispute through trial or jury in a court of law. However, this shall not prevent either Party from seeking preliminary equitable or injunctive relief from a court of competent jurisdiction without breaching this arbitration clause.

original: (a) Any unresolved Dispute which was subject to Section  12.2 and is not a Reserved Dispute, shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules and Supplementary Procedures for Large Complex Disputes of the American Arbitration Association (“ AAA ”) and otherwise as set forth in this Section  12.3, and judgment on the arbitration award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
modified: (a) Any contested Issue arising from Sections outside of 12.2, excluding those classified as Reserved Issues, shall initially be addressed through good faith negotiations between the parties for a period of sixty days. If no resolution is reached within this timeframe, either party may elect to escalate the issue to binding arbitration under the Commercial Arbitration Rules and Supplementary Procedures for Large Complex Disputes of the American Arbitration Association (" AAA "), in accordance with Section 12.3. The prevailing party shall be responsible for initiating the arbitration proceedings, and the arbitrator's decision shall serve as a binding determination; however, neither party shall be entitled to seek judgment on the award unless the opposing party fails to comply with the arbitrator's ruling within thirty days after its delivery.

original: (e) Either Party may apply first to the arbitrator(s) for interim injunctive relief until the arbitration decision is rendered or the arbitration matter is otherwise resolved; provided, that if such Party determines that such injunctive relief cannot be awarded in a timeframe adequate to protect such Party’s interests, then a Party may, without waiving any right or remedy under this Agreement, seek from any court having jurisdiction any injunctive or provisional relief necessary to protect the rights or property of that Party pending resolution of the arbitration matter pursuant to this Section  12.3. The arbitrators shall have no Source: CYTODYN INC., 10-Q, 1/9/2020 authority to award punitive or any other type of damages not measured by a Party’s compensatory damages. The Parties further agree that the decision of the arbitrators shall be the sole, exclusive and binding remedy between them regarding determination of arbitration matters presented.
ollama_generated:
(e) In the event that either Party requires urgent preliminary relief before the final arbitration decision is rendered or the arbitration matter is settled, they have the right to initiate such request with the arbitrator(s). However, if a Party deems that such interim injunctive relief may not be granted in a timely manner sufficient to safeguard their interests, they are empowered, without relinquishing any rights or remedies under this Agreement, to petition any court with jurisdiction for the issuance of injunctions or provisional orders deemed necessary to protect their rights or property until the arbitration issue is resolved in accordance with Section 12.3.

It's essential to note that the arbitrators are granted no authority to impose punitive or any other form of damages beyond those equaling a Party's compensatory losses. The Parties hereby acknowledge that the arbitral decision serves as the sole, exclusive, and final remedy concerning the resolution of disputes presented under this Agreement.

original: (h) Except to the extent necessary to confirm an award or decision or as may be required by Applicable Laws, neither a Party nor an arbitrator may disclose the existence, content, or results of an arbitration without the prior written consent of both Parties.
ollama_generated: (h) It is permitted for either Party or an arbitrator to divulge the existence, content, or results of the arbitration, only when mandated by Applicable Laws or for the purpose of confirming an award or decision. In all other instances, prior written consent from both Parties must be obtained before any disclosure takes place.

original: Source: CYTODYN INC., 10-Q, 1/9/2020 12.8 Confidentiality . Any and all activities conducted under this Article 12 , including any and all proceedings and decisions hereunder, shall be deemed Confidential Information of each of the Parties, and shall be subject to Article 10 .
ollama_generated:
Revised Clause:

Confidentiality Obligation (Article 12): All activities undertaken in compliance with this Article 12, encompassing any related proceedings and determinations, are hereby considered Confidential Material of each Party, obligating all involved to maintain the utmost secrecy and abide by the provisions outlined in Article 10.

original: 12.9 WAIVER OF RIGHT TO JURY TRIAL . In connection with the Parties’ rights under this Article 12 , EACH PARTY, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY, AND INTENTIONALLY WAIVES ITS RIGHT TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION OR OTHER LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT AND THE TRANSACTIONS IT CONTEMPLATES. THIS WAIVER APPLIES TO ANY ACTION OR LEGAL PROCEEDING, WHETHER SOUNDING IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE.
modified: 12.9 RIGHT TO REQUEST JURY TRIAL . In connection with the Parties' obligations under this Article 12, each Party reserves the right, to the extent permitted by law, to request a trial by jury in any action or other legal proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement and the transactions it contemplates. This right applies to any action or legal proceeding, whether sounding in contract, tort, or otherwise. The Parties acknowledge that any election to waive this right may be made at their sole discretion, but such waiver shall not be construed as a general waiver of any other rights or remedies available under law or this Agreement.

original: (b) Defense . Upon receipt of notice under this Section  13.3 from the Indemnitee, the Indemnifying Party will have the duty to either compromise or defend, at its own expense and by counsel (reasonably satisfactory to Indemnitee) such Claim. The Indemnifying Party will promptly (and in any event not more than twenty (20) days after receipt of the Indemnitee’s original notice) notify the Indemnitee in writing that it acknowledges its obligation to indemnify the Indemnitee with respect to the Claim pursuant to this Article 13  and of its intention either to compromise or defend such Claim. Once the Indemnifying Party gives such notice to the Indemnitee, the Indemnifying Party is not liable to the Indemnitee for the fees of other counsel or any other expenses subsequently incurred by the Indemnitee in connection with such defense, other than the Indemnitee’s reasonable out of pocket Third Party expenses related to its investigation and cooperation, except as otherwise provided in the next sentence. As to all Claims as to which the Indemnifying Party has assumed control under this Section 13.3(b) , the Indemnitee shall have the right to employ separate counsel and to participate in the defense of a Claim (as reasonably directed by the Indemnifying Party) at its own expense; provided, however, that if the Indemnitee shall have reasonably concluded, based upon a written opinion from outside legal counsel, that there is a conflict of interest between the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnitee in the defense of such Claim, in which case the Indemnifying Party shall pay the fees and expenses of one (1) law firm serving as counsel for the Indemnitee in relation to such Third Party Claim.
ollama_generated:
(b) Defense Obligations. Upon receipt of notice under Section 13.3 from the Indemnified Party, the Indemnitor shall have the discretion to either settle or defend, at its sole expense and with counsel satisfactory to the Indemnified Party, the Claim. The Indemnitor will promptly (and in any event within twenty (20) business days of receiving the original notice) communicate to the Indemnified Party in writing that it is evaluating its obligation to indemnify the Indemnified Party with respect to the Claim under Article 13 and whether it intends to settle or defend. Once the Indemnitor communicates this intent, it will not be liable to the Indemnified Party for any legal fees or other expenses incurred by the Indemnified Party subsequent to its initial defense, except for the Indemnified Party's reasonable out-of-pocket costs related to its investigation and cooperation, unless otherwise specified. In instances where the Indemnitor assumes control of a Claim under Section 13.3(b), the Indemnified Party shall have the right to engage separate counsel and participate in the defense of the Claim (as directed by the Indemnitor) at its own expense. However, if the Indemnified Party concludes, based on a written opinion from independent legal counsel, that there is a potential conflict of interest between the Indemnitor and the Indemnified Party in the defense of the Claim, then the Indemnitor will be obligated to cover the costs of two separate law firms: one serving as counsel for the Indemnified Party in relation to the third-party claim.

In this revised clause, the Indemnitor's obligation to defend has been shifted from a duty to a discretionary right, giving them more control over the defense process. Additionally, the timeframe for notification of intent to indemnify or defend has been changed to twenty business days (from twenty days) and clarified that the Indemnitor is not liable for expenses subsequent to its initial defense. Furthermore, the Indemnified Party now has the potential to incur additional costs if they deem there is a conflict of interest between themselves and the Indemnitor during the defense process.

original: 14.9 Further Assurance . Each Party shall duly execute and deliver, or cause to be duly executed and delivered, such further instruments and do and cause to be done such further acts and things, including the filing of such assignments, agreements, documents, and instruments, as may be necessary or as the other Party may reasonably request in connection with this Agreement or to carry out more effectively the provisions and purposes hereof.
modified: 14.9 Further Assistance: Upon reasonable request from the other Party, each Party shall endeavor to facilitate but not be obligated to execute or deliver additional instruments, perform further acts, or complete necessary tasks, including the filing of assignments, agreements, documents, and instruments. This assistance is intended solely to aid in the execution of this Agreement and to support its objectives; however, no Party shall be held responsible for any failure or delay in providing such assistance if it deems such action to be unreasonably onerous or detrimental to their interests.

original: 14.11  Construction . Except where the context otherwise requires, wherever used, the singular shall include the plural, the plural shall include the singular, and the use of any gender shall be applicable to all genders. Whenever this Agreement refers to a number of days without using a term otherwise defined herein, such number refers to calendar days. The terms “including,” “include,” “includes” or “for example” shall not limit the generality of any description preceding such term and, as used herein, shall have the same meaning as “including, but not limited to,” and/or “including, without limitation.” The language of this Agreement shall be deemed to be the language mutually chosen by the Parties and no rule of strict construction shall be applied against either Party hereto. Each Party represents that it has been represented by legal counsel in connection with this Agreement and acknowledges that it has participated in the drafting hereof. In interpreting and applying the terms and provisions of this Agreement, the Parties agree that no presumption will apply against the Party which drafted such terms and provision.
ollama_generated:
14.11 Interpretation and Scope. For the purpose of clarity, all pronouns encompass both singular and plural forms, and vice versa. Gender-neutral language is intended to be applicable to all genders. The term "days" mentioned elsewhere in this Agreement, unless specifically defined, shall refer to business days, as determined by mutual agreement between the Parties.

The terms "including," "include," "includes," or "for example" are illustrative and not exhaustive, carrying the same meaning as "including, but not limited to," and/or "including, without limitation."

This Agreement is a collective effort of both parties, and no provision will be strictly construed against either party. Each Party acknowledges that they have been advised by their respective legal counsel during the drafting process. In any disputes concerning this Agreement's terms and conditions, neither party shall have an advantage due to having drafted a particular provision.

In the event of interpretation ambiguity, the Parties agree to collaborate in good faith to reach a mutually satisfactory resolution.
